meanings.definition: To keep someone away from other people.
meanings.sent1: Parents may seclude their children at home to protect them from getting sick.
meanings.sent2: The hermit chose to seclude himself in the mountains, far from the bustling city.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to seclude all the nuts in a secret hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: After a long day at work, she likes to seclude herself in a cozy corner with a good book.
meanings.sent5: The magician secludes the rabbit in a hat before pulling off a surprising trick.

meanings.definition: To shut off or keep apart, as from company, society, etc.
meanings.sent1: During the lockdown, the government had to seclude the entire city to prevent the spread of the virus.
meanings.sent2: The castle's high walls seclude the royal family from the rest of the town.
meanings.sent3: The faulty remote control accidentally secludes the TV from responding to any commands.
meanings.sent4: The thick fog seemed to seclude the small village from the outside world.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious island secludes its treasures behind hidden traps and puzzles.

meanings.sent1: The chef had to seclude the spoiled ingredients from the fresh ones to avoid contamination.

meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy managed to seclude the squeaky toy under the couch.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds seclude the leaves from their branches, scattering them across the yard.
meanings.sent5: The artist decided to seclude the bright colors from the rest of the painting to create a focal point.
